senses.de: Easy to use or reachable, does not require extra effort
senses.ex: The store is in a convenient location

Tips.title: Ease of Use
Tips.description: Describes something that is easy to use without any complications or additional steps.
Tips.example: This tool is convenient for quick repairs.

Tips.title: Physical Reach
Tips.description: Often relates to how physically close and easy it is to get to a place or item.
Tips.example: The coffee machine is very convenient for employees.

senses.de: Suitable for your purposes and needs and causing the least difficulty
senses.ex: It's very convenient to pay by credit card.

Tips.title: Personal Fit
Tips.description: Highlights the personal benefit and suitability of a choice or action.
Tips.example: Our meeting schedule is convenient for all attendees.

Tips.title: Least Resistance
Tips.description: Implies choosing an option that presents the least obstacles or hassle.
Tips.example: Using the app is the most convenient way to book tickets.

senses.de: Taking less time or effort, thus making life easier or more comfortable.
senses.ex: It's convenient to order food on the internet.

Tips.title: Saves Effort
Tips.description: Emphasizes the reduction in effort or energy required to do something.
Tips.example: Microwave meals are convenient after a long day at work.

Tips.title: Time Management
Tips.description: Used when talking about actions or choices that save time.
Tips.example: Having a dishwasher at home is very convenient.

Tips.title: Comfort Enhancement
Tips.description: Refers to something that is designed to make life more comfortable and pleasant.
Tips.example: The hotel's location next to the beach was very convenient.

Accessible.wordDefinition: Accessible means that something is easy to reach or obtain. For example, a building is accessible if it has a ramp and wide doors for people with disabilities.

Comfortable.wordDefinition:
Comfortable refers to something that is pleasant or enjoyable, and makes you feel relaxed and at ease. For example, a comfortable bed or chair.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Comfortable is applicable to things that we use for a longer period, such as our bed, clothes, or furniture.

Easy.wordDefinition:
Convenient means that something is designed or arranged in a way that makes it well-suited to a particular purpose. For example, a convenient store is one that is situated in a place that is easily accessible to customers.

Easy means that something can be done without difficulty or effort. For example, a math question may be easy to solve when the answer is straightforward.

Convenient is more likely to be used to describe a situation, place or thing that is well-suited or well-adapted to a particular purpose, while easy is more likely to be used to describe a task or activity that is simple or doesn't need much effort to complete.

For example, a parking lot may be convenient to use, but it might not necessarily be easy to park in a tight space.

Effortless.wordDefinition:
Effortless means something that requires little to no effort, like a task that can be completed without much physical or mental exertion.

In essence, convenient refers to a feature that makes a task easier to accomplish, while effortless refers to the ease with which a task can be completed.

Handy.wordDefinition:
Handy means something that is useful or helpful in a particular situation. For example, having a screwdriver and pliers in your toolbox is handy when you need to fix something.

Both words relate to making things easier, but convenient refers to general ease and simplicity while handy refers to being useful in a specific situation.

Simple.wordDefinition:
Convenient means easy to use or access, while simple means not complicated.

For example, a microwave is convenient because it's easy to use, but it may not necessarily be simple to operate, as it has various settings and buttons.

A basic calculator is simple to use but may not be convenient for more complex mathematical problems.

Convenient is applicable when something is easy to access or use, while simple is applicable when something is not complicated or difficult to understand.

Smooth.wordDefinition:
Smooth means that something has no roughness or difficulty, making it easy to navigate or operate. For example, a smooth car ride is one without bumps or sudden movements.

Convenient is more focused on accessibility and ease of use, while smooth is more focused on how easy it is to operate or navigate something.

Suitable.wordDefinition:
Suitable refers to something that is appropriate for a particular purpose or situation. For example, a formal suit would be suitable for a job interview.

Convenient describes things that are easy or efficient to use, while suitable describes things that are appropriate or well-matched for a specific purpose or situation.

quotes.Text: As a musician, you want the music in as many hands as you can get it into. More importantly, I want people to get the music for the fairest price, and in the most convenient way. And that's really turned into iTunes when you're talking about selling albums.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Kid Rock

quotes.Text: Technology does more than delight, entertain and make our lives more convenient, it's also an agent for social good. That is why it's important for tech startups to stay informed about, and make a mark on, policies that impact them.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Ron Conway

quotes.Text: Banks and credit agencies learn continuously about the purchases we make. This is convenient and diminishes the risk of theft. It also means that banks can know more about our lifestyle than our close relatives.
quotes.Title: British Scientist
quotes.Name: Mark Walport

quotes.Text: I found that dance, music, and literature is how I made sense of the world... it pushed me to think of things bigger than life's daily routines... to think beyond what is immediate or convenient.
quotes.Title: American Dancer
quotes.Name: Mikhail Baryshnikov

quotes.Text: Songwriting wasn't my gift. I think you have to cultivate a gift; you have to practice and develop craft around your gift so that you can execute it in more convenient, efficient ways.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Linda Ronstadt

quotes.Text: Flipping our classrooms into active learning spaces really is important and having these convenient spaces where people feel comfortable.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Megan Smith

quotes.Text: It may not always be easy, convenient, or politically correct to stand for truth and right, but it is the right thing to do. Always.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: M. Russell Ballard

quotes.Text: I hate it when characters know things but only reveal them when it's convenient to the story. I'd never do that. That's cheating.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: Simon Toyne

quotes.Text: I see some people stay in one place because it's convenient or it's comfortable. But they're missing out on their passion.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Arianna Huffington

quotes.Text: TaskRabbit is a safe and convenient way for you to hire someone to help you with your chores around the house.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Stacy Brown-Philpot
